page.title: 06Stock Farming - Gunton
page.content: The amount of land laid down to pasture has declined in recent years although an area of approximately 80 acres has been relaid in the Gunton Hall Park. Intensive livestock farming of pigs and beef cattle is frequently combined with arable farming. Pig-breeding on a moderate scale is also undertaken. A herd of 80 cows is the only one kept for dairying purposes. With the increased automation of many of the farming methods employment oppotunities are small, although seasonal casual employment is offered. Within Gunton Park Dairy Farm, the only part of the old Gunton Estate still owned by the Hardbord Family is let to a local farmer.
